title: How to Make Baked Eggplant and Ricotta Rolls

steps.headline: Spray two large baking trays with olive oil; spray to lightly grease.
Cut the eggplants into 1 centimeter (0.4 in) thick slices lengthwise.
steps.description: Arrange the eggplant, in a single layer, on the prepared trays. Lightly spray with olive oil spray.

steps.headline: Bake in oven for 10 minutes or until golden.
Meanwhile, place the ricotta, basil and three quarters of the Parmesan in a medium bowl and stir until well combined.
Place 1 tablespoon of the ricotta mixture on 1 eggplant slice.
Roll up firmly to enclose filling.
Place the roll, seam side down, in the baking dish.
steps.description: Repeat with the remaining ricotta mixture and eggplant.

steps.headline: Pour the tomato sauce evenly over the rolls.
steps.description: Sprinkle with mozzarella and remaining Parmesan.

steps.headline: Bake in oven for 10 minutes or until the mozzarella melts.

text: Preheat oven to 200ºC.  Spray two large baking trays with olive oil; spray to lightly grease.  Cut the eggplants into 1 centimeter (0.4 in) thick slices lengthwise. Arrange the eggplant, in a single layer, on the prepared trays. Lightly spray with olive oil spray. Bake in oven for 10 minutes or until golden.  Meanwhile, place the ricotta, basil and three quarters of the Parmesan in a medium bowl and stir until well combined. Taste and season with pepper. Place 1 tablespoon of the ricotta mixture on 1 eggplant slice.  Roll up firmly to enclose filling.  Place the roll, seam side down, in the baking dish. Repeat with the remaining ricotta mixture and eggplant. Pour the tomato sauce evenly over the rolls. Sprinkle with mozzarella and remaining Parmesan. Bake in oven for 10 minutes or until the mozzarella melts.  Finished.
